root: ^SAM: Good evening, Mrs. Maloney. And how're you?

s: ^MARY: Patrick's decided he's tired and doesn't want to eat out tonight.
^MARY: Patrick won't eat out tonight. He said he's got something to do.
^MARY: Patrick's leaving me, Sam, and he's saying "Don't make a fuss, it's bad for my job"!

c-1: ^Very well then. Will it be the usual, peas
c-2: ^SAM: Oh my, Mrs. Maloney. What a scoundrel he is!
^SAM: In any case, it's not my place to intervene.
^SAM: If I see him, I will give him a good berating on your part!
